content: Based on discussion just now, we realized that our validation steps say to match keys based on "kid" and "alg", but this should really be "kid" and "kty", since a given key can be used with >1 signing algorithm. The important thing is to match based on the id, and ensure we know whether it's an RSA vs EC key (which "kty" tells us). I've proposed https://github.com/smart-on-fhir/fhir-bulk-data-docs/pull/77 to correct this (just a tiny spot-fix).
...so a JWK with only "kty", "kid", "n" and "e" is (would be) valid, correct?
Made this change in the Cerner server
